bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 147 (Tuesday, September 13, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BACON:H.R. 8804.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section VIII, Clause 14: ``Congress shall havethe power to . . . make rules for the government andregulation of the land and naval forces. . .''[Page H7784]

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023

latestAction.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR S6063-6466)

item.title: James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

bill.title: Air Force Rated Officer Retention Program Act

item.title: Air Force Rated Officer Retention Program Act
Air Force Rated Officer Retention Program Act
To direct the Secretary of the Air Force to establish a demonstration program to assess and improve the retention of certain officers serving on active duty in the Air Force.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
